subject: Re: [junit] Generating reports from command line
msgSnippet: ... It is possible, but not trivial.  And the junit task is probably one of the most complex beasts here. Another option might be adding Ant s
messageBody:
On Mon, 04 Jul 2005, J. B. Rainsberger <jbrains@...> wrote:

> To get the Ant task's XML output, though, I'm not sure. I suppose
> you could just invoke the Ant junit task through Java, although I
> have no idea how much environment setup Ant provides and how easy
> that is. I've never tried it.

It is possible, but not trivial. And the junit task is probably one
of the most complex beasts here.

Another option might be adding Ant's XMLJUnitResultFormatter as a
TestListener to your tests - Ant's formatters are TestListeners after
all. No, I've never tried that myself either.

Stefan
